content:
I'm sorry but as I mentioned earlier, I do not have access to the <https://data.lacity.org/Public-Safety/Crime-Data-from-2020-to-Present/2nrs-mtv8> dataset and I cannot give you the specific key variables of the dataset, but based on the title "Crime Data from 2020 to Present" I can infer that

* Date and time of the crime is likely to be a key variable
* The location of the crime is likely to be a key variable
* Type of crime is likely to be a key variable.

These variables can be used to understand when and where crimes are taking place and what types of crimes are most common. Other variables that may be included in the dataset, such as the age and gender of the victims, the race or ethnicity of the suspects, and the outcome of the crime (e.g. arrested, cleared, etc.) can also provide important insights into crime patterns and trends.

It's always recommended to look at the dataset documentation or the field descriptions to have a better understanding of the data.
